articles.author: Reuters
articles.title: UK authorises gene therapy for blood disorders in world first - Reuters
articles.description: Britain has authorised a gene therapy that aims to cure sickle-cell disease and another type of inherited blood disorder for patients aged 12 and over, the country's medical regulator said on Thursday, becoming the first in the world to do so.
articles.content: LONDON, Nov 16 (Reuters) - Britain has authorised a gene therapy that aims to cure sickle-cell disease and another type of inherited blood disorder for patients aged 12 and over, the country's medica… [+1671 chars]

articles.author: Eleanor Olcott
articles.title: Alibaba ditches plans to spin off cloud business and list supermarket - Financial Times
articles.description: Shares fall 10% after Chinese ecommerce giant says US export controls have created ‘uncertainties’ for its cloud business
articles.content:
Alibaba has ditched plans to spin off its cloud business and paused the listing of its supermarket unit amid waning investor enthusiasm for the Chinese ecommerce giants radical restructuring plan.

articles.title: Bitcoin hit $38,000 despite US financial regulator’s decision to delay two BTC ETF decisions - FXStreet
articles.description: Bitcoin price crossed the $38,000 level for the first time in nearly 17 months, on November 15.
articles.content:
• Bitcoin price hit $38,000 for the first time since May 2022, amid anticipation for approval of spot BTC ETF.
